alert.note: Alert for Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 11 at 8:51PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH which is in effect until 5 AM MST Friday... * WHAT...The combination of strong winds and new snow falling on a weak snowpack will create widespread areas of unstable snow. Avalanche danger is expected to rise to High tomorrow with very dangerous avalanche conditions through Saturday. * WHERE...The mountains of western Wyoming including the Snake River, Salt River, Wyoming, Gros Ventre and Teton Ranges. The mountains of southeast Idaho including the Palisades, Elk Mountains and Big Holes. This backcountry avalanche warning does not apply to highway avalanche programs or operating ski areas. * WHEN...In effect from Thu 18:00 MST to Sat 22:00 MST. * IMPACTS...Natural and human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury people are almost certain to occur. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from below slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotelyâ€”from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may involve deeper weak layers of snow and produce a larger avalanche than expected. Avalanches could run onto low angle terrain, hitting paths or groomed snowmobile trails. Consult http://bridgertetonavalanchecenter.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

area.areaDesc: Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
